content.question: A student measures the mass of a sample of a metallic element, <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Then the student heats the sample in air, where it completely reacts to form the compound <math alttext="M O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>MO</mtext></mrow></math>. The student measures the mass of the compound that was formed. Which of the following questions can be answered from the results of the experiment?

choices.label: What is the density of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></math>?
What is the molar mass of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></math>?
What is the melting point of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></math>?
What is the melting point of <math alttext="M O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>MO</mtext></mrow></math>?

content.answer: What is the molar mass of <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
